text: Van het vat op ZBF 2017. U: Wazig stroblond met een witte schuimkraag. G: Lichte citrus en mandarijntoetsen. Ook wat bleekmout en gist. S: Moutzoet met een lichte bitterheid. M: Doordrinker met een stevige carbonatie.
Pale blond with fluffy head. Fairly gassy and watery. Similar to an English bitter shandy.
From tap. Pours hazy yellow with a small white head. Aorma is light fruity, toasted. Bitter, citrusy and crisp hoppy. Bitter and mellow fruity far finish.
UPDATED: APR 23, 2017 Tap. Hazy orange color with white head. Aroma is farty, grainy. Taste is grainy, but also unfermented wort. Medium carbonation. There are much better beers in this ABV range.
Sampled @ Zythos Bier Festival 2017. Leicht trübes goldgelbes Bier. Geruch ist mild hopfig, getreidig und brotig. Geschmack ist leicht trocken hopfig, grasig, gut.

At Zythos 2017.
Pours cloudy very pale yellow.
Aroma is cat food, low malts.
Body is very light, thin, watery and not many flavours. Crisp carbonation. Dry and refreshing, but no good flavours. Meh.
Deutlich bitter hopfiger Antrunk. Weich herb, wässrig getreidig, langweilig. 10/8/9/8//8

Accents of green grape, gooseberry, shrub all subtly perched as if in Perrier.

5/II/17 - on tap @ Brugs Bierfestival - BB: n/a (2017-127) Thanks to 77ships, kraddel and Rubin77 for sharing todays beers!
Clear pale yellow beer, big solid creamy white head, little stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: some sulphur first, later more sweet smells, malty, fruity notes. MF: ok carbon, medium body (impressive!). Taste: little bitter, grains, bit herbal, somewhat fruity, soft bitterness. Aftertaste: dry, some almonds, grassy, bitter finish, decent beer!
Bab 2016. Thnx to Tderoeck and 77ships for sharing the beers ! Pours unclear blonde, small white head. Smell is bit yeasty, some citrus. Taste is sharp, citrussy. Some malts. Light mf, ok carbo.

Thank you for sharing kraddel + tderock + Rubin77! Sampled @ Bruges Beer Festival 2017. Hazy orange, off-white head. Nose is grass, green, raw barn, low vegetables, raw grains & other grains. Body is too fizzy, yeasty. Taste is fizzy, huge plaster, yeast, chalk notes, sugar, herbal & some less pleasant other grain notes. Not a fan of this one with the chalk, yeast & vegetable notes.

F: not big, white, average retention.
C: yellowish to gold, hazy.
A: malt, sour, wheat, fruity, herbal.
T: malt, orange peels, fruity, herbal, taste is better than the aroma, for me nothing very tasty, light body, medium carbonation, thanks to the BE RB crew for sharing beers today! Sampled @ Bruges beer festival 2017.

20170205 draught at BAB. A good white foam layer. The yellow beer is slightly cloudy. Aroma is just somewhat malt with a clear citrus like hop aroma (grapefruit). Hardly no sweetness, which give beer a thin body. Direct we will taste some sour, which is fast take over by bitter. The bitter becomes dry. Fruity of yellow grapefruit, some peach and light citrus. Not bad for a 3.3% beer.
